title: _Begriffsschrift_ Chapter III Following in a sequence
content: ` p ( t+ `` R ) c ` means ` c ` follows ` p ` in the ` R ` -sequence. ~ dffrege76 through ~ frege98 develop this. This will be shown to be the transitive closure of the relation ` R ` . But more work needs to be done on transitive closure of relations before this is ready for Metamath.

blocks.name: dffrege76
blocks.content: If from the two propositions that every result of an application of the procedure ` R ` to ` B ` has property ` f ` and that property ` f ` is hereditary in the ` R ` -sequence, it can be inferred, whatever ` f ` may be, that ` E ` has property ` f ` , then we say ` E ` follows ` B ` in the ` R ` -sequence. Definition 76 of [Frege1879] p. 60. Each of ` B ` , ` E ` and ` R ` must be sets. (Contributed by RP, 2-Jul-2020.)

blocks.name: frege77
blocks.content: If ` Y ` follows ` X ` in the ` R ` -sequence, if property ` A ` is hereditary in the ` R ` -sequence, and if every result of an application of the procedure ` R ` to ` X ` has the property ` A ` , then ` Y ` has property ` A ` . Proposition 77 of [Frege1879] p. 62. (Contributed by RP, 29-Jun-2020.) (Revised by RP, 2-Jul-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm frege98(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ⊢ (c0[(t+ ` c1)]c2 →(c2[(t+ ` c1)]c3 → c0[(t+ ` c1)]c3))
  ⊣ c0 ∈ c4
  ⊣ c2 ∈ c5
  ⊣ c3 ∈ c6
  ⊣ c1 ∈ c7
} = {
  3imtr3i(c0[(t+ ` c1)]c2, (c2[(t+ ` c1)]c3 → c0[(t+ ` c1)]c3), c2 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }), (c2[(t+ ` c1)]c3 → c3 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 })))
  ax-mp((c2 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 })→(c2[(t+ ` c1)]c3 → c3 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }))), c1[hereditary]((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }))
  frege97(c1, c0, c4, c7)
  frege84(c1, ((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }), c2, c3, c5, c6, c7, universe)
  ax-mp(((t+ ` c1)" { c0 })∈ 𝕌, (t+ ` c1)∈ 𝕌)
  fvex(ctcl, c1)
  imaexg((t+ ` c1), universe, { c0 })
  bitr4i(c2 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }), c0[(t+ ` c1)]c2, < c0, c2 > ∈(t+ ` c1))
  elimasn(c2, (t+ ` c1), c0)
  elexi(c2, c5)
  df-br(c0, (t+ ` c1), c2)
  imbi2i(c2[(t+ ` c1)]c3, c3 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }), c0[(t+ ` c1)]c3)
  bitr4i(c3 ∈((t+ ` c1)" { c0 }), c0[(t+ ` c1)]c3, < c0, c3 > ∈(t+ ` c1))
  elimasn(c3, (t+ ` c1), c0)

}
